document_data.name: Giant bombardier beetle
document_data.mainbody: '''Giant bombardier beetles''' were a species of giant [[beetle]].
document_data.Description: The bodies of bombardier beetles generally grew to be around {{SIrange|4|6|ft|long=yes}} in length.
document_data.Combat: As a defense mechanism, bombardier beetles were able to expel clouds of reddish [[acid]]ic vapor from their abdomens that had a horrible smell. The sound of them expelling this acid could be deafening, potentially stunning nearby creatures. They could also emit a cloud of [[fire]] to protect themselves, a few times per day.

Ecology.Diet: Unlike many beetles, bombardier beetles were solely carnivores, feeding mostly on carrion and gathering carcasses as places to lay their eggs.
Ecology.Habitats:
Bombardier beetles were typically found to dwell above-ground in forests of warm climate regions.

In [[north Faerûn]] they were known to inhabit parts of [[Cormanthor]]'s forests and the [[Dragon's Eye]] in the [[Spine of the World]]. In [[south Faerûn]] they could be found in the [[Forest of Amtar]] and the [[Lluirwood]], as well as the [[Mere of Dead Men]].

On the [[Chultan Peninsula]], giant bombardiers were a common sight in the jungles of the nation of [[Samarach]].

Beyond Toril, they could be found on the planet of [[Krynn]].
Ecology.Usage: The substances inside bombardier beetles could be harvested from dead specimens and used create small explosives.

document_data.History: In the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]], the [[Chang Emporium]] shipped bombardier beetles alongside [[fire beetle|fire]] and [[tangler beetle]]s on the [[caravel]] [[Dragonfly (caravel)|''Dragonfly'']] to the city of [[New Velar]], intending to have them sold by [[Lin-Woh]] as guardian animals. However, once there an offloading accident occured, leading cages to crash to the ground and unleash many of the beetles trapped within them.<ref>{{Cite organized play/LFR/The Prospect|5-6}}
